name: Nervous System
purpose: Coordinates body activities by transmitting signals to and from different parts of the body.

name: Circulatory System
purpose: Transports oxygen, nutrients, hormones, and waste products throughout the body.

name: Digestive System
purpose: Breaks down food into nutrients and absorbs them into the body.

name: Respiratory System
purpose: Facilitates the exchange of oxygen and carbon dioxide between the body and the environment.

name: Immune System
purpose: Defends the body against infections and foreign invaders.

name: Muscular System
purpose: Enables movement of the body and internal organs.

name: Skeletal System
purpose: Supports and protects the body while providing a framework for movement.

name: Integumentary System
purpose: Protects the body from the external environment and regulates temperature (e.g., skin, hair).

name: Endocrine System
purpose: Releases hormones into the blood to regulate bodily functions like growth and metabolism.

name: Urinary System
purpose: Removes waste products and regulates water and electrolyte balance.

name: Reproductive System
purpose: Enables organisms to reproduce and produce offspring.

name: Lymphatic System
purpose: Maintains fluid levels in the body and supports immune functions.
